title: Looking for a crude, hand drawn font with lots of opentype loveliness
content:
Hi  
I'm looking for a font for a corporate identity somewhat similar to this one.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820173457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dolcevita_5921.png)
  
However, I need it to be able to automatically swap glyphs. To keep the hand-drawnfeel I need change one of two neighbouring instances of the same glyph.
author: alexfjelldal

comments.content: Just resurrect Saul Bass and have him letter it for you. :-)

These guys have some great fonts with all the OT lovelyness you want:

[http://www.myfonts.com/search/pintassilgoprints/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820173457/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/pintassilgoprints/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/pintassilgoprints/fonts/")

Delve Fonts just released a new hand written looking font with the OT features to match called "sketchnote"  
 [http://www.delvefonts.com/sketchnote.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820173457/http:/www.delvefonts.com/sketchnote.html)

It's a lot more hand drawn than your sample, but it is impressive.
